epyr.constants module

The epyr.constants module provides physical constants, unit conversions, and nuclear data relevant to EPR spectroscopy.

Overview

This module contains:

  • Fundamental constants: Planck constant, Bohr magneton, etc.

  • EPR-specific constants: g-factors, magnetogyric ratios

  • Unit conversions: Gauss ↔ Tesla, frequency ↔ field

  • Nuclear isotope data: Spins, abundances, NMR frequencies

Physical Constants

Fundamental Constants

Created on Tue May 6 09:52:16 2025

@author: sylvainbertaina

epyr.constants.SPEED_OF_LIGHT_SI = 299792458.0

  1. Speed of light in vacuum (SI). Exact.

epyr.constants.VACUUM_PERMEABILITY_SI = 1.25663706212e-06

(μ₀) Magnetic constant / Vacuum permeability (SI). CODATA 2018.

epyr.constants.VACUUM_PERMITTIVITY_SI = 8.8541878128e-12

(ε₀) Electric constant / Vacuum permittivity (SI). CODATA 2018. Calculated from μ₀ and c.

epyr.constants.PLANCK_CONSTANT_SI = 6.62607015e-34

  1. Planck constant (SI). Exact.

epyr.constants.REDUCED_PLANCK_CONSTANT_SI = 1.0545718176461565e-34

(ħ) Reduced Planck constant (h-bar = h/2π) (SI).

epyr.constants.ELEMENTARY_CHARGE_SI = 1.602176634e-19

  1. Elementary charge (magnitude) (SI). Exact.

epyr.constants.ELECTRON_MASS_SI = 9.1093837015e-31

(mₑ) Electron mass (SI). CODATA 2018.

epyr.constants.PROTON_MASS_SI = 1.67262192369e-27

(mₚ) Proton mass (SI). CODATA 2018.

epyr.constants.FINE_STRUCTURE_CONSTANT = 0.0072973525693

(α) Fine-structure constant (dimensionless). CODATA 2018. Same in SI & CGS.

epyr.constants.BOHR_MAGNETON_SI = 9.2740100783e-24

(μ<0xE2><0x82><0x8B>) Bohr magneton (SI). μ<0xE2><0x82><0x8B> = eħ / (2mₑ).

epyr.constants.NUCLEAR_MAGNETON_SI = 5.0507837461e-27

(μ<0xE2><0x82><0x99>) Nuclear magneton (SI). μ<0xE2><0x82><0x99> = eħ / (2mₚ).

epyr.constants.ELECTRON_G_FACTOR = -2.00231930436256

(gₑ) Electron g-factor (free electron) (Dimensionless). CODATA 2018. Negative sign indicates moment opposes spin angular momentum.

epyr.constants.PROTON_G_FACTOR = 5.5856946893

(gₚ) Proton g-factor (Dimensionless). CODATA 2018.

epyr.constants.ELECTRON_GYROMAGNETIC_RATIO_SI = -176085963022.23312

(γₑ) Electron gyromagnetic ratio (SI). γₑ = gₑ μ<0xE2><0x82><0x8B> / ħ. Approx -1.7608 × 10¹¹ rad⋅s⁻¹⋅T⁻¹.

epyr.constants.ELECTRON_GYROMAGNETIC_RATIO_MHZ_T_SI = 28024.951424085102

(|γₑ|/2π) Electron gyromagnetic ratio magnitude in MHz/T (SI). Approx 28024.95 MHz/T.

epyr.constants.PROTON_GYROMAGNETIC_RATIO_SI = 267522187.44441766

(γₚ) Proton gyromagnetic ratio (SI). γₚ = gₚ μ<0xE2><0x82><0x99> / ħ. Approx 2.6752 × 10⁸ rad⋅s⁻¹⋅T⁻¹.

epyr.constants.PROTON_GYROMAGNETIC_RATIO_MHZ_T_SI = 42.57747851853565

(|γₚ|/2π) Proton gyromagnetic ratio magnitude in MHz/T (SI). Approx 42.577 MHz/T.

Usage Examples

Basic Constants

from epyr import constants

# Fundamental constants
h = constants.PLANCK_CONSTANT      # 6.626e-34 J⋅s
μ_B = constants.BOHR_MAGNETON      # 9.274e-24 J/T
g_e = constants.ELECTRON_G_FACTOR  # ~2.002

# Calculate EPR frequency
B_field = 3350  # Gauss
B_tesla = B_field * constants.GAUSS_TO_TESLA
frequency = g_e * μ_B * B_tesla / h
print(f"EPR frequency: {frequency/1e9:.3f} GHz")

Field-Frequency Conversions

# Convert between magnetic field and EPR frequency
field_gauss = 3350  # Typical X-band EPR field
g_factor = 2.0      # Free electron g-factor

# Calculate corresponding frequency
freq_hz = field_gauss * g_factor * constants.MHZ_PER_GAUSS_PER_G_FACTOR * 1e6
print(f"Frequency: {freq_hz/1e9:.2f} GHz")

# Unit conversions
field_tesla = field_gauss * constants.GAUSS_TO_TESLA
field_mt = field_tesla * 1000  # Convert to mT
print(f"Field: {field_gauss} G = {field_tesla:.4f} T = {field_mt:.1f} mT")

g-Factor Calculations

# Calculate g-factor from EPR parameters
frequency_hz = 9.4e9  # 9.4 GHz X-band
field_gauss = 3350    # Resonance field

# g = hν / (μ_B × B)
field_tesla = field_gauss * constants.GAUSS_TO_TESLA
g_factor = (constants.PLANCK_CONSTANT * frequency_hz) / \
           (constants.BOHR_MAGNETON * field_tesla)

print(f"g-factor: {g_factor:.6f}")

Common EPR-Relevant Isotopes

The isotope database includes nuclear properties for common isotopes encountered in EPR:

Hydrogen isotopes: - ¹H: I=1/2, 99.98% abundance, γ=42.577 MHz/T - ²H (D): I=1, 0.02% abundance, γ=6.536 MHz/T

Carbon isotopes: - ¹²C: I=0, 98.9% abundance (EPR silent) - ¹³C: I=1/2, 1.1% abundance, γ=10.705 MHz/T

Nitrogen isotopes: - ¹⁴N: I=1, 99.63% abundance, γ=3.078 MHz/T - ¹⁵N: I=1/2, 0.37% abundance, γ=-4.316 MHz/T

Usage Example:

# Access nuclear data
if hasattr(constants, 'ISOTOPE_DATA'):
    isotopes = constants.ISOTOPE_DATA

    # Get proton data
    if 'H' in isotopes and '1' in isotopes['H']:
        proton = isotopes['H']['1']
        spin = proton.get('spin', 0.5)
        gamma = proton.get('gamma', 42.577)  # MHz/T
        abundance = proton.get('abundance', 99.98)  # %

        print(f"¹H: I={spin}, γ={gamma} MHz/T, {abundance}% abundant")

EPR Parameter Calculations

Hyperfine Coupling

# Calculate hyperfine coupling in different units
A_gauss = 10.0  # Hyperfine coupling in Gauss
A_mhz = A_gauss * constants.MHZ_PER_GAUSS_PER_G_FACTOR
A_tesla = A_gauss * constants.GAUSS_TO_TESLA

print(f"Hyperfine coupling: {A_gauss} G = {A_mhz:.2f} MHz = {A_tesla*1e4:.1f} mT")

Nuclear Zeeman Effect

# Nuclear Zeeman splitting for ¹H in EPR field
B_field = 3350 * constants.GAUSS_TO_TESLA  # Tesla
gamma_proton = 42.577e6  # Hz/T (magnetogyric ratio)

nuclear_freq = gamma_proton * B_field  # Nuclear Larmor frequency
print(f"Proton Larmor frequency: {nuclear_freq/1e6:.2f} MHz")
